intro: Chamaecrista brachyrachis, commonly known as the short-stemmed crown flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, yellow flowers clustered in racemes. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of numerous small, oval leaflets, and it produces elongated, stipitate pods that contain several seeds. Chamaecrista brachyrachis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
